name: AURA ART CONNECTS THE TWO WORLDS OF ART AND FASHION
venue: Pooja House, Opp JW Mariott, Juhu, Mumbai
details: Event Detail
desc1: In line with its vision of connecting a wider spectrum of society to fine art, Aura Art eConnect Pvt Ltd ("AAeCPL") is proud to be the Exclusive Art Partner for Amy Billimoria House of Design ("ABHD"). ABHD is a luxury destination for fashion, jewelry and art, founded by leading fashion designer Amy Billimoria, in association with Pankti Shah and is located in the prestigious and strategic neighborhood of Juhu.
desc2: We are delighted to invite you to ABHD on May 9, 2015 from 11am to 7pm, at Pooja House, next to Starbucks Café, opp JW Mariott, Juhu, to view a large array of fashion and design products, besides relishing paintings by renowned artists like S Yousuf Ali, Manjit Bawa, Umesh Varma, Sidharth, Vrundavan Solanki, Charan Sharma, Ajay De, Veguri Ravindra Babu, Tejinder Kanda and sculptures by Ratilal Kansodaria, Bhawan Rampure, Sachin Dadhich.
desc3: The design house was launched on May 7, 2015 amidst much fanfare, in the august presence of leading celebrities and dignitaries like Rani Mukerji, Esha Deol, Ayushmann Khurrana, Lucky Morani, Talat Aziz, Mahesh Chhabria, Anjali Chhabria,Nilesh Ganjwala,Yogesh Lakhani, Bhagyashree, Suchitra Krishnamoorthi, Anup Jalota, Tanishaa Mukerji, Deepti Gujral amongst others.
desc4: This is a novel initiative where a unique ambience has been created for an exciting display of both top of the line fashion products and the best of fine art under one roof. In a venue like this, Aura Art eConnect looks forward to a convergence of sensitivities - of colour, form and texture - that compliment each other and enhance the viewing pleasure.You are welcome to partake in this heady concoction of art, fashion and design, which will be available at the design house 7 days a week from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm.

name: Aura Art Show 2013 at Jehangir Art Gallery, Mumbai
details: You are cordially invited to a mega art event, Aura Art Show 2013 Incredible artworks of more than 50 artists – from select masters to promising artists of calibre! We would like to share the following further details, in relation to the show: - Photographs of the Inauguration Ceremony and the subsequent days. - Videos of the key speeches at the Inauguration Ceremony - Media Coverage We have provided a link to the e-catalogues, which have been created in two versions, for your convenience: - Catalogue in e-book format - Catalogue in html

name: Art and Culture exchange between India & China
details:
The two Giant neighbours, India and China, celebrated the 65th anniversary of the establishment of bilateral diplomatic relations on March 31, 2015. To mark this historic occasion, the Consul General of People’s Republic of China, His Excellency, Mr Zheng Xiyuan, hosted a reception for the distinguished guests and artists from India and dignitaries and artists from China, at ITC Grand-Maratha, Sahar Road, Mumbai.

In order to strengthen the friendly relations between the two countries, a special delegation comprising leading luminaries from the world of art and culture visited Mumbai, including:
- Mr Song Ronghua, Secretary General of China Public Diplomacy Association
- Mr Hu Jiebao, Executive VP of China International Art & Business Alliance 
- Mr Shu Hnan and Mr Ding Ding, the great film personalities of China who produced in 2010, the world famous Chinese movie, “Lost in Thailand” which revolutionised the growth of Chinese Tourism in Thailand. 

The Chinese delegation had an opportunity to rub shoulders with leading Indian dignitaries like:
- Shri Sumit Mullick, Additional Chief Secretary and Chief of Protocol, Govt of Maharashtra
- Mr Adi H Jehangir, Chairman, Jehangir Art Gallery
- Mr Anil Dharker, Eminent Writer and Journalist
- Mr Kiran Shantaram, Indian film personality and former Sheriff of Mumbai
- Mr Daljit Singh Sethi, Chairman, Aura Art 
- Mr Jackie Shroff, leading actor

Aura Art e-Connect Pvt Ltd and China Public Diplomacy Association put together the display of Indian and Chinese Art (paintings, sculptures and photographs). On display were the paintings by renowned and respected Chinese artists like Lin Yongsong, Zhu Daoping, Cui Jin and Yin Xioping and Indian artists such as Manjit Bawa, Paramjit Singh, S Yousuf Ali, Prem Singh, Sidharth, Umesh Varma, Veguri Ravindra Babu and Prashant Salvi. The visiting Chinese artists also had the pleasure of interacting with Indian artists such as Dilip Ranade, Prakash Ghadge, Rajendra Kapse. 

Rishiraj Sethi, Director, Aura Art eConnect Pvt Ltd presented a broad overview of the global art scene, with special reference to Indian and Chinese art market. Mr Johny ML, reputed art historian, critic and curator presented an interesting perspective of Indian Art History, as relevant to the audience and introduced the Indian artists present and artworks displayed. Akanksha Goenka, part of the Research and Training team at Aura Art introduced the Chinese artists present and reflected on their techniques. Harmeet Sethi, Director, Aura Art eConnect Pvt Ltd organised a walkthrough of the artworks on display. The ceremony was conducted by Ms Gayathri Batra, the renowned media specialist. 

The occasion was further electrified by live demonstration by Chinese calligraphy artists while Master Sculptor Ratilal Kansodaria created a sculpture piece and Prakash Bal Joshi and Charan Sharma created paintings, alongwith Chinese artists.

name: Art Partner for The Edutainment Show 2014
details: Aura Art was delighted to be Art Partner for “The Edutainment Show 2014”, organised in JW Mariott Mumbai on April 26-27, 2014. Rishiraj Sethi, Director, Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd made a presentation titled “Alternate Careers in Creative Fields (including Art)” to an audience comprising of stalwarts from creative fields, aspiring professionals and educational institutions from across the world. Besides providing an overview of Indian Art, Rishiraj gave a perspective of the Art Infrastructure Services being offered by Aura Art, to illustrate the opportunity for parallel careers for aspirants in various creative fields. The audience also enjoyed the paintings by Veguri Ravindra Babu, which mirrored their aspirations and struck a deep chord.

name: Art Partner for Yes Bank International Polo Cup
details: Aura Art enriched the Yes First Lounge at the ARC Polo Ground, Mahalaxmi Race Course, during the Yes Bank International Polo Cup organised on March 22, 2014, with display of art. Aura Art is thanful to Yes Bank and Amateur Riders' Club for this opportunity to interact with the lovers of the sport, with paintings and sculptures related to the event

name: Inviting participation for The Art Enclave at UBM Index Fairs 2015
details:
Enthused by the overwhelming response to the first edition of The Art Enclave (October 2014), Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd (AADPL )is pleased to announce the Second Edition of The Art Enclave, to be held at Index Fairs 2015, from October 15-18, 2015, at MMRDA Exhibition Center, Bandra-Kurla Complex, Mumbai. AADPL invites you to exhibit paintings, sculptures, prints and photographs at The Art Enclave in Index Fairs 2015. Look forward to hearing promptly from you to book the best location in The Art Enclave and to avail of enhanced benefit from the multi-pronged promotion strategy. Accordingly, have attached the Invite for Participation and the Exhibitor Application Form for The Art Enclave at Index Fairs 2015 and the Post Show Report for 2014. 

To recap, AADPL has entered into long- term collaboration with UBM Index Trade Fairs Pvt Ltd, for incorporating an exclusive Fine Art Section starting from Index Fairs 2014. Index Fairs, India's monumental event for interiors, architecture and design, is organised by UBM Index Trade Fairs Pvt Ltd, which is now part of Universal Business Media (UBM), a UK-based world leader in trade shows. Index Fairs celebrated 26 successful years of service to the industry in 2014 and looks forward to offering the renowned Index service and focused business expertise to grow the business of its partners, from India and overseas. 

We would be glad to involve you in this interesting initiative, which is in line with UBM INDEX vision of providing an integrated platform for interiors and design and Aura Art vision to fill the gaps in the Indian Art Industry - by working closely with the design space to meet the Art requirements of various architects, interior designers, hotels, hospitals, corporates, real estate developers, home, office and trade buyers and professional specifiers from across the country. 
Post Show Report 2014

name: Art Infrastructure – nobody’s business
details:
Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd (“AADPL”) was the Strategic Partner to a niche event “Protecting the Treasures of the World” organised on December 14, 2013 at Taj Lands End, Mumbai. The event offered interesting perspectives on art conservation, innovative museum display technologies, lighting techniques and pest management in the context of art and museums. Aura Art demonstrated the use of these innovative technologies with the display of masterly works by Manjit Bawa and Dhruva Mistry.
Rishiraj Sethi (Director, AADPL) presented his views on the growth potential of the Indian Art Market and expressed the need to develop Art Infrastructure Services to facilitate the growth, through his presentation aptly titled “Art Infrastructure – nobody’s business”. Rishiraj also covered practical case studies of some large collections in India and the challenges being faced in managing the same.

name: Veguri Ravindra Babu’s Installation at High Street Phoenix
details: High Street Phoenix organised "Noise - the Silent Killer" Week, from April 23-29, 2011, by displaying the widely appreciated Installation “Aspiring Reconciliation” and select paintings of Veguri Ravindra Babu. To mark International Noise Pollution Day and in keeping with the spirit of enriching the shopping experience, High Street Phoenix announced its “Art Wednesday” initiative, wherein two Art Sessions were organised on April 27, during which the Artist shared the motivation behind his Installation and Paintings. In addition, Professor Shrishail Shintre (Head of Department and Lecturer at Department of Sculpture, Sir JJ School of Art, Mumbai) interacted with the audience on the Art of Sculpting.

name: Saini S Johray’s Installation at Kala Ghoda Arts Festival 2012
details: In continuation of its crusade against Noise Pollution, Aura Art presented the Installations by Saini S Johray, at the Kala Ghoda Arts Festival 2012. The Installations were made in Fiberglass using material made by Satyen Polymers, a leading manufacturer of Gelcoats, Resins and Specialty Polymers. The high quality of execution of the Installations evoked the curiosity and interest of art lovers, space designers and artists on the potential that fiberglass offers as a medium.It has also brought about some interesting questions on the appropriateness of fiberglass to various situations (for instance strength of the medium, suitability for outdoors, ease of working, manner of painting etc). The same was answered by Satyen Polymer in Aura Art’s Art Thought Leadership Series - Untapped potential of Fiberglass as a Medium.

name: The Art Enclave at UBM Index Fairs 2014
details: Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd (“AADPL”) is delighted to announce a long term collaboration with UBM Index TradeFairs Pvt Ltd, for incorporating an exclusive Fine Art Section in INDEX FAIRS, India's monumental event for interiors, architecture and design. INDEX 2014 is being held on 9-10-11-12 October, 2014 at MMRDA Exhibition Center, Bandra-Kurla Complex, Mumbai. The Art Enclave at INDEX 2014 comprises of leading Galleries and Artists from across the country, displaying quality paintings, sculptures, photographs and prints. The Art Enclave, which is managed by AADPL, will be located in the first quadrant as you enter the venue, adjacent to the International Pavilion. INDEX FAIRS is organised by UBM Index TradeFairs Pvt Ltd, which is now part of Universal Business Media (UBM), a UK-based world leader in tradeshows. Index Fairs celebrated 25 successful years of service to the industry in 2013 and looks forward to offering the renowned Index service and focused business expertise to grow the business of its partners, from India and overseas. We would be glad to involve you in this interesting initiative, which is in line with UBM INDEX vision of providing an integrated platform for interiors and design and Aura Art vision to fill the gaps in the Indian Art Industry - by working closely with the design space to meet the Art requirements of various architects, interior designers, hotels, hospitals, corporates, real estate developers, office and home buyers. Other details of Index Fairs 2014 can be perused at http://ubmindexfairs.com/.

name: The Indian Luxury Expo
details: Aura Art is delighted to share details of the The Indian Luxury Expo, which will be organised at Grand Hyatt from April 26-28, 2013. The Indian Luxury Expo is India’s first multi-city luxury expo, showcasing some of the most prominent uber-luxury brands, cutting across 20 lifestyle segments to an elite and discerning target audience. Aura Art is the Exclusive Art Partner to The Indian Luxury Expo and will be showcasing paintings, sculptures and installations from the finest artists in the country at the Expo. Entry to be Luxury Expo, other then for VIP invitees, will be against a registration fee.

name: Wassup! Andheri, 2013 - A grand Art & Entertainment Festival
details: Aura Art is delighted to invite you to the second edition of Wassup! Andheri. Aura Art is again the Art Partner for the event. More than 15 large installations will be displayed on the grounds, and more than 50 paintings, sculptures and photographs will adorn the curated Gallery section. Works of renowned artists like Arzan Khambatta, Sidharth, Ratilal Kansodaria, Hitesh Gilder, Sangeeta Singh, Sukant Panigrahy, Veguri Ravindra Babu, Jayant Parikh, Mukesh Parpiani, to name a few, will be exhibited. Aura Art is proud to have Arzan Khambatta on the Panel of Wassup Andheri 2013 at the "Fine Arts (Sculptures / Installations)" Section and Sidharth at the "Fine Arts (Paintings)" Section. You may refer to the Wassup!,2013 link to get a preview of the Installations.

name: Aura Art organised live painting demo at AGP Multi Million Race Day
details: Aura Art is pleased to announce that it conducted an Art Event for AGP Multi Million Race Day, organised by Ashvin Gidwani Productions, at Mahalaxmi Race Course, on February 17, 2013. Race lovers and other guests were mesmerized by the rapid strokes of Artist Raamji Sharma's brush, as he created a racing horse within 10 minutes. Aura Art is grateful to Ashvin Gidwani and Priya Kothari for this unique opportunity to promote art amidst an august audience.

name: Aura Art is delighted to be Exclusive Art Partner for AICOG 2013
details: In furtherance of its initiative to promote Art in the Healthcare environment, Aura Art was the Exclusive Art Partner for the 56th All India Congress of Obstetrics and Gynecology (AICOG) which was held from January 16-20, 2013 in BKC, Mumbai, by The Mumbai Obstetric and Gynecological Society (MOGS), under the aegis of the Federation of Obstetric and Gynecological Societies of India (FOGSI). Being held in Mumbai after 27 years, in terms of participation it was the largest medical conference conducted in the last 50 years, with over 10,000 delegates. Aura Art showcased the paintings of Deepak Jogdand, Veguri Ravindra Babu and Madan Lal at this prestigious event. In the words of Dr Arun John, Gynecologist and Healthcare Consultant with Innergize Solutions, "Aura Art is doing an incredible job of capitalising on their Healthcare relationships to promote art, keeping the sensibilities of both the streams in perspective.. creating a win-win proposition for apparently separate worlds, but which nonetheless have a very strong underlying connect - human care and welfare".

name: Group Show at The Capital  -  Fundraiser for Cuddles Foundation
details: Aura Art is pleased to invite you to a Group Show, from January 15 to 21, 2013, between 11am to 8pm, at The Capital, a prestigious commercial development by The Wadhwa Group, in BKC, Mumbai (located behind ICICI Bank and IL&FS Towers). Select photos of the VIP Preview organised on January 12, 2013, which was attended by more then 250 art lovers and featured a live demonstration by Tejinder Kanda (leading spatula artist) have been posted below. This Show comprising of 50+ paintings and sculptures by prominent Indian artists, is organised as a Fundraiser for The Cuddles Foundation, set up with the Mission to impact the lives of children from low income groups by giving them access to best medical equipment, medicines and environment that aid faster recovery. We welcome you to peruse through e-catalogue for details of the paintings and sculptures, that will be available for viewing and purchase at the Event. Look forward to having you over to enjoy the art and support an important cause, which marks another milestone in Aura Art's journey of utilising Art as a medium to further the cause of Healthcare.

name: Show of Paintings by Veguri Ravindra Babu at The Capital, BKC, Mumbai
venue: Entrance lobby and the sky lobby on third floor
details: With a view to promote art in some of the best developments in the country, Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd displayed its paintings at The Capital, a prestigious commercial development by The Wadhwa Group, in BKC, Mumbai. Aura Art launched this initiative with the display of paintings by Veguri Ravindra Babu in the entrance lobby and the sky lobby on third floor of The Capital. The Capital is located behind ICICI Bank and IL&FS Towers and hosts some of the biggest names in the financial services industry, top private equity funds, diamond & ancillary services and large Indian Business Houses. The Capital is a 21st century edifice that goes beyond a conventional construction. This magnificent commercial building makes a statement that it is part of a future that is strong, progressive and liberal. This cutting edge edifice showcases an everlasting and contemporary façade, while its interiors feature a rich palette of colours and textures. The Capital has already won many prestigious, such as "Best Commercial High Rise Development in India" by International Property Awards Asia Pacific 2012-2013 and "Commercial Property of the Year" by Realty Plus Excellence Awards 2012 and Stars of the Industry 2012.

name: India Art Festival, 2012
details: Aura Art participated in the India Art Festival, 2012 held at MMRDA Ground, BKC, Mumbai. View the Paintings by various artists, displayed at our stalls. The new series of wall mounted relief sculptures created by Ratilal Kansodaria in bronze, using the age old lost wax process, were also on display. View his Sculptures, which emanates from his love for rural life and his fondness for purity prevalent amongst rural folk.

name: Aura Art bridges gap between Art and Indian Film Industry
details: With a view to bridge the gap between Art and Indian Film Industry, Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd is pleased to announce that Paintings and Sculptures from its collection are displayed in the Movie "Heroine", which releases on September 21, 2012. Paintings by Sidharth, Hema Joshi, Arunanshu Chowdhury, Veguri Ravindra Babu, VS Upadhyay, Vinay Sharma, Rakesh Kumar, Rajiba Lochan Pani and Sculptures by Ratilal Kansodaria and Hitesh Gilder adorned Kareena Kapoor's house, in the Movie. Aura Art would like to thank Ronnie Screwvala (Producer), Madhur Bhandarkar (Producer & Director) and Sukant Panigrahy (Production Designer) for involving us in this prestigious project. Aura Art continues its endeavor of extending the boundaries of where original Art can be and should be displayed and looks forward to many more such initiatives for promoting Art.

name: Wassup! Andheri - A grand Art & Entertainment Festival
details: An initiative by F5 Advertainment with Aura Art as Art Partner, “Wassup!” is a three day festival that celebrates the socio-cultural spirit of this largest and most lively Mumbai suburb - Andheri. This festival is a platform that'll define 'Whats New' in the city. To be held from March 16-18, 2012, in the scenic garden, next to Lokhandwala Bridge, Andheri. It promises to be packed with non-stop entertainment through different art forms like Paintings, Installations, Photography, Theatre, Literature, Fashion, Culinary, Music and Dance, among others. Aura Art is the Art Partner for the event. More than 15 large installations will be displayed on the grounds, and more than 50 paintings, sculptures and photographs will adorn the Gallery section. Works of renowned artists like Charan Sharma, Hema Joshi, Bhagwan Rampure, Vinay Sharma, Hitesh Gilder, Ratilal Kansodaria, Jayant Parikh, Nimisha Sharma, Prithvi Soni, Prakash Ghadge, Pankuj Parashar to name a few, will be exhibited.

name: Aura Art bridges gap between Art and Healthcare
venue: 65th Indian Dental Conf, Bandra Kurla Comple
details: Aura Art displayed artworks at the 65th Indian Dental Conference, organised from February 9-12, 2012, at Bandra Kurla Complex, Mumbai. Dentists from across the country were fascinated to witness a rare treat of more than 50 paintings and sculptures, from a diverse set of artists. In addition, Rishiraj Sethi, Director, Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd made a presentation to the august audience. Aura Art is grateful to the Indian Dental Association (IDA) for this opportunity. This marks the beginning of a series of initiatives being planned by Aura Art to promote Art in the Healthcare environment, since artworks create a welcoming and stimulating environment, conducive to improving wellbeing and promoting a positive image of healthcare.

name: Art display at Pravasi Bharatiya Divas 2012
details: Aura Art was the sole exhibitor of Art at the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas 2012, inside the prestigious Birla Auditorium, in Jaipur, during the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas Convention, organised from January 7-9, 2012. The Aura Art Exhibtion comprised of artworks of leading artists from Rajasthan, namely V S Upadhyay, Chintan Upadhyay, Vinay Sharma, Dharmendra Rathore, Rameshwar Singh, Surendra Pal Joshi and Suneet Ghildial. In addition, the Exhibition also included artworks of the choicest artists from across the country, namely Sidharth, Umesh Varma, Dilip Ranade, Haku Shah, Vrundavan Solanki, Veguri Ravindra Babu, Ratilal Kansodaria, Nagji Patel, Rini Dhumal, Sanjay Kumar, Shailesh Patel, Tejinder Kanda, Shekhar Paul, Bhushen Koul, BR Bodade, Jayant Parikh and Madan Lal. The 10th Pravasi Bhartiya Divas, held in the Pink City, is the biggest edition so far with around 2,000 delegates from 60 countries. Besides exposing Indian Art to the Indian community settled overseas, such initiatives will go a long way in sensitising the Government and related agencies to the potential of Indian Art Industry and the impediments in achieving the same, which will in turn give a great boost to Indian Artists.

name: Group Show of Modern and Contemporary Indian Art, Hutheesing Centre, Ahmedabad
venue: L & P  Hutheesing Visual Art Centre, Ahmedabad.
details: Hutheesing Centre and Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd organized a group show of Modern and Contemporary Indian Art from Friday, 02 December, 2011 to Saturday, 10 December, 2011 at L & P Hutheesing Centre, Ahmedabad. About 50 Paintings and Sculptures by 29 renowned Artists from all over India were exhibited. The Show was Inaugurated by Chief Guest Shri Vijay Nehra - Collector, Ahmedabad The Guests of Honour were - - Shri Hasmukh C Patel - Chairman, HCP Design & Project Management Pvt Ltd - Shri Pradyumna Vyas - Director, National Institute of Design

name: India Art Festival, 2011
venue: Stall #11, Ground Floor, Nehru Centre, Mumbai
details: Aura Art participated in the India Art Festival, 2011 held at Nehru Centre, Mumbai. Paintings and Sculptures of various Artists were displayed.

name: Group Show of Paintings and Sculptures at Surat
venue: Art Gallery, Science Centre, City Light Rd, Surat.
details: Aura Art Development Pvt Ltd in association with Titaanium Ventures (promoted by Mr Tejaas Kapadia) takes pleasure in inviting you to Inauguration of an Exhibition of Modern and Contemporary Indian Art (Paintings and Sculptures) at 5 pm on Friday, October 7, 2011 at the Art Gallery, Science Centre, City Light Road, Surat - 395 007. The exhibition continues 11 am - 9 pm through October 8 & 9, 2011. The show comprises of paintings and sculptures of the following 30 artists: Ratilal Kansodaria, Nagji Patel, Vrundavan Solanki, Deepak Kannal, Jayant Parikh, Mahendra Pandya, Arunanshu Chowdhury, Shailesh Patel, Bhushen Koul, Sidharth, Umesh Varma, Dilip Ranade, Sanjay Kumar, Veguri Ravindra Babu, Tejinder Kanda, Somnath Banerjee, Vidyasagar Upadhyay, Viren Tanwar, Vigyan Vrat, Sushila Bodade, Isha Diwanji, Amarnath Sharma, Prabhakar Alok, Prandeep Kalita, Rajiba Lochan Pani, BR Bodade, Lokesh Khodke, Prashant Salvi, Dinesh Gain & Madan Lal. The Opening will be graced by the following Guests of Honour: - Shri Chandrakant R Sanghavi: Chairman, Sanghavi Exports Int Pvt Ltd - Shri Manoj Kumar Das: Municipal Commissioner, Surat - Shri Kamal Tulsian: Chairman, J R Group - Shri Surendra Kapur: Promoter, Vadodara Sculpture Park - Shri Jagrut Patel: Vitan Architects

name: Kala Ghoda Arts Festival, 2011
details: Aura Art is pleased to announce the launch of the stunning Installation by Veguri Ravindra Babu - ‘Aspiring Reconciliation’ - at the Kala Ghoda Arts Festival 2011.

name: ICICI Lombard (Signature Club) and Aura Art jointly participate in Art Mart II
details: Display of works from the Aura Art collection, participation by Rishiraj Sethi (Chief Strategist, Aura Art) in panel discussion on “Appreciating & Collecting Art” and presentation to HNIs on “Art: Wealth Creation and Insurance”

name: Solo Show - Tejinder Kanda - July 2010, The Bombay Yacht Club
details: Tejinder Kanda, an artist from Delhi, delighted members of the European Business Group (EBG), by creating a work live at The Bombay Yacht Club. The artist, who worked continuously for 2 hours, left the audience breathless with his mastery over the spatula technique (the technique involves the use of a palette knife instead of a brush to paint on canvas that helps add interesting texture and produce beautiful fluid ridges). The members were further enthralled to view other works and interact with the artist, after he had given the finishing touches to his work.

name: Web-launch of installation by Veguri Ravindra Babu:
details: As one of its biggest contributions yet to Indian Contemporary Art and Global Environment, Aura Art is delighted to launch an Installation by a young talented artist Veguri Ravindra Babu, titled “Disturbed Landscapes - A way of life”… at http://www.auraart.in/VeguriRavindraBabu (please click on Enter, after seeing the flash presentation) You will witness the deep thought process of Veguri Ravindra Babu, which goes way beyond the apparent images/ installations that he creates, as you steer through the following pages: * Note by Mr HC Parikh, Retired Director General of Income Tax and noted writer and speaker on the cause of Environmental Protection and Ecological Preservation * The “Artist’s Note”, which conveys both - his desperation as well as his inspiration behind this art work. * A compiled view of the “Installation” through an array of photographs from day 1 to day 6 will help you connect with this awesome installation. * A “Video” on the day wise evolution/germination of the installation offers a visual treat.

name: Inauguration of Shlok Aurangabad '10
details: Harmeet Singh Sethi, CEO, Aura Art, was Guest of Honour at the inauguration of Shlok Aurangabad '10 on April 09, 2010 at Lokmat Bhavan in Aurangabad. Shlok - initiated by Mrs Sheetal Rishi Darda - is an upcoming organisation, commited to promoting art and culture, providing a platform to talented artists from that region. It derives inspiration from Jawaharlal Darda Kala Akademi set up in memory of late Shri Jawaharlal Darda of Lokmat Group.

name: Group Show - The Leela Galleria, Bangalore - April 8 (7.30pm) to 11, 2010
details: The Leela Galleria (Bangalore), in association with Aura Art (Mumbai), takes pleasure in inviting you to Reality Behind The Visible - a group show of Modern and Contemporary Indian Artists, over cocktails, accompanied by a Brass Band from World Music Center on Thursday 8th April, 2010, 7.30pm. The Exhibition continues 9th - 11th April, 2010, 11am - 7.30pm at The Leela Galleria, The Leela Palace Kempinski Bangalore.

name: Show - Viren Tanwar & Madan Lal - March 9 to 20, 2010 - Art Desh & Aura Art
venue: White House Annex, Grd Flr, 91 Walkeshwar Road
details: Art Desh - The Studio and Aura Art proudly present the works of renowned artists Viren Tanwar and Madan Lal.

details: All are welcome to join the Aura Art Group, on Face Book: http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=249086014915&ref=nf

name: Session on "Alternative Investment Ideas"
details: Presentation made by Harmeet Singh Sethi (CEO, Aura Art) to Doctors, at the Ahmedabad Management Association (AMA), Ahmedabad, on Investing in Art. The session was organised by Wealth First Advisors Pvt Ltd.

name: Session on "Alternative Investment Strategies"
details: Presentation made by Harmeet Singh Sethi (CEO, Aura Art) at the Knowledge Academy in Ahmedabad. The Knowledge Academy, promoted by Anagram Capital Limited, is an Authorized Education Provider of Financial Planning Standards Board (FPSB) India.

name: Solo Show - Jayant Parikh - Sept 26 to Oct 3, 09 - Art Desh and Aura Art
venue: Aura Art: Kalina; Art Desh: Walkeshwar Road

name: Solo Show - Jayant Parikh - Sept 24, 2009 - Four Seasons Hotel, Worli, Mumbai
details: Www.bestofbombay.com, together with Aura Art, wants to create a unique experience for every art lover, through its ‘Evening with an Artist’ initiative - to allow people to interact with an artist and get a glimpse into his mindset, perception, motivation and sensibility. To begin with, Aura Art is pleased to present Mr Jayant Parikh, a leading artist from Baroda, whose works will be displayed and the artist requested to give a live demonstration of his work, besides interacting with art lovers.

name: Solo Show - Veguri Ravindra Babu - July 2009, TAJ Mahal Hotel, Mumbai
details: Veguri Ravindra Babu’s paintings were widely appreciated by those present at an exclusive event conducted by the European Business Group (EBG) on July 30, 2009, at the TAJ Mahal Hotel, Colaba, Mumbai. Mr Harmeet Singh Sethi, CEO, Aura Art introduced Ravindra Babu to the august audience and also released the folder containing images of select paintings, besides the write-ups of leading critics who have expressed their views on Ravindra Babu’s artworks. Ravindra Babu then interacted at length with the audience for a couple of hours, where he shared his journey so far and provided insights into his sensibilities and thought process. The overwhelming appreciation of Ravindra Babu’s paintings, by attendees, is a further demonstration of the international appeal of his artworks.
